qas.question: Vacuum tubes in early computers were replaced by what?
Transistors are typically made up of what today?
A computer that is made using pool balls is known as what?

context: Historically, computers evolved from mechanical computers and eventually from vacuum tubes to <a0_0>transistors<a0_0/>. However, conceptually computational systems as flexible as a personal computer can be built out of almost anything. For example, a computer can be made out of billiard balls (<a2_0>billiard ball computer)<a2_0/>; an often quoted example.[citation needed] More realistically, modern computers are made out of transistors made of <a1_0>photolithographed semiconductors<a1_0/>.
